"medial, premedial, prefinal. Derives a body part medial from a body part medial, or a body part final from a body part final, or functions as a classifier for holes. Compare medials -anw-, -a*nakw-, -a*ne*-.Cf. PA waa0i 'hole' (inanimate singular noun), PA -aa0ak- 'hole' (medial). Note that n/sh alternations in Meskwaki nouns were all leveled in one direction or the other. [Related:] initial wa*sh-. [Related:] medial -a*nakwe*-. [Related:] inanimate noun final -a*nakw. [Related:] IN wa*nakw-.

tokens.notes: "postradical. Classifier for springy wood or metal. Meskwaki -a*k- has a Unami cognate -a*k*- meaning `roof' (i.e., bent branches or withies). Unami -a*k- occurs e.g. in xkwi*t*a*k*e `on top the roof' (with a long "t" and a long "k"); Unami xkwi*t*a*k*e is the equivalent of Meskwaki ahkwitapahkwe. IG's comment, from an email dated 26 January 2019: "*-a:k- is a classifier for houses in Delaware < bent poles." "
